H0.text: Food is what the plant makes when it uses water to move materials up from the roots.

H1.text: Light is made by the plant when water is used to move materials up from the roots.

H2.text: Chlorophyll is produced by the plant by moving materials up from the roots using water.

H3.text: Fruit is made by water being used by the plant to move materials up from the roots.

A4.text: The sugars produced during carbon metabolism yield carbon skeletons that can be used for other metabolic reactions like the production of amino acids and lipids.

A5.text: Plants absorb light primarily using the pigment chlorophyll.
